timeline.message:
BrokerSilentTokenCommandParameters null check for sdktype

Adding a null check for sdktype in BrokerSilentTokenCommandParameters

timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -324,7 +324,7 @@ public BrokerSilentTokenCommandParameters brokerSilentParametersFromBundle(
                 .authenticationScheme(getAuthenticationScheme(context, brokerRequest))
                 .androidApplicationContext(context)
                 .accountManagerAccount(account)
-                .sdkType(brokerRequest.getSdkType())
+                .sdkType(brokerRequest.getSdkType() == null ? SdkType.MSAL : brokerRequest.getSdkType())

replies.bodyText: this was caught in the test pass
replies.author: tanmaymanolkar1

replies.bodyText: Right - we should add a unit test for this behavior of MsalBrokerRequestAdapter so that we don't require a manual test in order to catch it next time.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: Agreed. @tanmaymanolkar1 I suggest you create a work item in your backlog to add a unit test for this. I don't think we necessarily have to do it right now as I don't want to block the release process.
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: That works.  Typically my ideal flow would be - write test exposing break, fix code to close break, break is now proven fixed.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx
